intro: Echioglossum williamsonii, commonly known as the Williamson's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
